semantic_title: Use of Sequela External Cause Codes for Subsequent Visits
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > i. Sequelae (Late Effects) of External Cause Guidelines > 3) Use of sequela external cause codes for subsequent visits

content.full_text: Use a late effect external cause code for subsequent visits when a late effect of the initial injury is being treated. Do not use a late effect external cause code for subsequent visits for follow-up care (e.g., to assess healing, to receive rehabilitative therapy) of the injury when no late effect of the injury has been documented. (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
content.summary: Guidelines for when to use sequela external cause codes during subsequent visits based on treatment purpose (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
key_concepts: Use for subsequent visits treating late effects (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35)
Do not use for routine follow-up care (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
Distinction between late effect treatment and healing assessment (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use late effect external cause code when treating late effect during subsequent visit (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a patient returns for treatment of a documented late effect or sequela of the original injury, use the sequela external cause code (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35)
detailed_rules.applies_to: subsequent visits for late effect treatment
common_applications: Treatment of chronic conditions from old injuries

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not use late effect external cause code for routine follow-up care (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
detailed_rules.explanation: For subsequent visits that are for routine follow-up, healing assessment, or rehabilitative therapy without documented late effects, do not use sequela external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine purpose of subsequent visit
Step 2: If treating documented late effect, use sequela external cause code
Step 3: If routine follow-up without late effect, do not use sequela code

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient returns for treatment of chronic pain from old injury
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Follow-up visit for chronic back pain, late effect of motor vehicle accident
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify visit is for treating late effect
Step 2: Code the chronic condition being treated
Step 3: Use sequela external cause code with 7th character 'S'

correct_coding.sequencing: Current condition first, sequela external cause second
correct_coding.rationale: Treating documented late effect during subsequent visit (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35)

incorrect_coding.code: Sequela external cause for routine follow-up
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use for routine follow-up without late effect
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using sequela codes for all subsequent visits

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient returns for routine healing check after fracture
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Follow-up visit to assess fracture healing, no complications
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify this as routine follow-up
Step 2: Note no late effects documented
Step 3: Do not use sequela external cause code

correct_coding.rationale: Routine follow-up without documented late effects (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use sequela code for routine follow-up
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using sequela codes for all post-injury visits

warnings: Do not use sequela codes for routine follow-up without documented late effects (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
best_practices: Distinguish between late effect treatment and routine follow-up (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
Use sequela codes only when treating documented late effects (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35)
common_mistakes: Using sequela codes for all subsequent visits regardless of purpose (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
tips: Look for documentation of late effects vs routine care (Evidence: pg no: 91, L35-L36)
